author: eronlewis
body: In the documentation for Powershell commands, can it be listed which versions of powershell the command works with? EX. get-localgroupmember command only works in Powershell 5.1 and up. But you have to check on the left hand side where it says Powershell version to see if the command is compatible with a certain version. This could just be listed at the top of the documentation of each command.

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body:
@eronlewis This would be lovely!

But I'd recommend filing this issue in the https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell-Docs repo, as that repo typically handles the help files. 😄

comments.author: eronlewis

comments.author: kilasuit
comments.body: @eronlewis the URL is linked within the issue on github and auto shrinks it so you will need to view on Github not via your emails

title: Powershell Versions
